reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Lekeitio by chance to experience a small seaside town in the Basque Country and it is highly recommended. The hotel is really a gem - fantastic rooms, fantastic views (choose a seaview room), fantastic service. A hotel built where the last empress of Austria/Hungary lived - the hotel has many details from the era including a photo of Emperatriz Zita in the reception. Go to Lekeitio, enjoy the fresh air and freindly people and stay at Emperatriz Zita
reviews.title: What a fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we this summer decided to go to the basque region for the third time, Lekeitio was one of the places we for sure wanted to vist again - mainly because of this hotel, and the huge room and balcony!
reviews.title: Our third visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, the hotel may have faded a bit (I still find it very nice), but you can´t beat the balcony and the view! Overlooking the pittoresque town and harbour, a small island, people relaxing on the beach just down below... Have some vino tinto, read a good book and enjoy the calming sound of the waves! Oh happiness =)
reviews.title: Time to relax

likes.liked: — the view, the room, and the fact that the room service did not wake us up in the mornings

reviews.title: Peaceful setting
reviews.text: We had some very relaxing days in room 305, and would highly recomment it! Especially if you want to take it easy and chill out for some days.
Last summer we stayed on our "tour basque" also in Lekeitio.
reviews.title: Perfect location in quiet Basque seaside village

reviews.text: In many ways, the Zita is a hidden gem. Leikitio is a small Basque summer seaside town, which I am sure not very many tourists from other countries find themselves. The Zita dominates the beach and is a modern, but very grand building, with many rooms offering sea views. The common areas are very beautiful but the rooms themselves are disappointing - twin beds pushed together in double rooms and bathrooms which are way past their best. There is a small thermal spa in the basement with a tiny jacuzzi and a thermal pool, but again, it is all faded glamour, the spa clearly hasn't been done up for years and it is a far cry from sparkling spas in most hotels nowadays. Staff are friendly and breakfasts are fine. All in all, I would not choose to stay there again but it is fine overall.
reviews.title: Faded Glamour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I just stayed for 2 nights at the Zita hotel in Lekeitio. We read every review possible on the place, and we had our apprehensions because of words like 'faded' and 'aged'. While these are slightly true (it's no Holiday Inn Express, people), it only adds to the allure of the place. You could say the hallway carpets could use a good shampooing, but otherwise the guest rooms were simple but stately. Fine local furniture, hardwood floors, gorgeous marble baths -- the essense of Basque charm. Besides Zita, there is no other noteworthy beachside hotel in town.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Lekeitio - and we searched around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were treated very graciously, upgraded to a junior suite, and situated with a balcony overlooking the incredible bay (we had only asked for a seaview room until check-in). The rates were competitive for this time of year, and worth every cent. We went on to stay a couple nights in San Sebastian, but wish we could have stayed longer at the Zita.
reviews.title: Slightly faded in its glamour but is spotlessly clean, the staff friendly and the meals seriously good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Emperatriz Zita is a grand hotel in the old style that would appeal to persons middle aged and above. We are early sixties and were there for four nights and it was just about right, some older clientele were there for many weeks at a time. The hotel is slightly faded in its glamour but is spotlessly clean, the staff friendly and the meals seriously good. (And seriously good value too). The breakfast buffet was well presented and well stocked.
reviews.title: Best Location on the Bay of Biscay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, which was a mini suite with balcony and sea view, was spacious with a large bathroom containing jacuzzi bath/shower. The tiny harbour is alongside and the hotel sits on a sandy beach, which connects to the slightly larger beach by walking along the sand at low tide. Surrounding the harbour there are tapas bars and the odd restaurant. The hotel has a spa associated but was down in the basement - we were not tempted to try it, possibly as the weather was too fine while we were there.
reviews.title: Best Vacation Spot Ever!!!

reviews.text: Lekeitio has little to speak of in terms of other things to do. Gernika is worth a visit. A note to the wise for travellers by car from either San Sebastian or Bilbao, there is a route from Durango to Markina, after which look for the left turn through Mereludi to Lekeitio which is by far the fastest route to the town. Intuitively road maps do not suggest this route
reviews.title: Lovely location
